rows.title: One thing today

transcript.eng:
Close your eyes and think about the day. 

Name one thing that you are grateful for. 
Name one thing that you did well. 
Name one thing that you love.

Well done, you are a hero!

rows.transcript:
Close your eyes and think about the day. 

Name one thing that you are grateful for. 
Name one thing that you did well. 
Name one thing that you love.

Well done, you are a hero!

text_1.eng: You matter! Take a moment to check in with yourself.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Great to hear that you are doing well. You are a wonderful parent!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Sorry that you are not having the best day. Well done for trying to figure everything out. Nobody has all the answers but you really do your best!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. Well done for getting up every morning and trying again, even when you are tired. That is real courage and dedication!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today we are learning about spending one-on-one time with your child. 

Spending dedicated and special time with your child will make them feel valued and loved.
It will also build trust and respect, and support their learning.

media_title.eng: Why is spending one-on-one time with your child important? Tap play to learn.

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings everyone!

Our children don't need expensive gifts. The best gift we can give them is to spend one on one time with them.

By spending time together, you will understand your child better and they will learn many new things.

Having this time together with your child will feel special because it will help them feel loved and valued. That will make everything easier at home!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today we are learning about spending one-on-one time with your child. 

Spending dedicated and special time with your child will make them feel valued and loved.
It will also build trust and respect, and support their learning.
rows.media_title: Why is spending one-on-one time with your child important? Tap play to learn.
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings everyone!

Our children don't need expensive gifts. The best gift we can give them is to spend one on one time with them.

By spending time together, you will understand your child better and they will learn many new things.

Having this time together with your child will feel special because it will help them feel loved and valued. That will make everything easier at home!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
One-on-one time can be fun for both of you!.

Let’s look at how @data.characters.f1_mother.name and @data.characters.f1_son_5.name do this!

character_1_text.eng: I have 5 minutes and I’d like to spend it with you, @data.characters.f1_son_5.name. What would you like to do?

character_2_text.eng: I want to play with my winter clothes!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
One-on-one time can be fun for both of you!.

Let’s look at how @data.characters.f1_mother.name and @data.characters.f1_son_5.name do this!
rows.character_1_text: I have 5 minutes and I’d like to spend it with you, @data.characters.f1_son_5.name. What would you like to do?
rows.character_2_text: I want to play with my winter clothes!

character_1_text.eng: Wonderful idea, @data.characters.f1_son_5.name! I see you are taking out the yellow scarf with blue stripes on it.

rows.character_1_text: Wonderful idea, @data.characters.f1_son_5.name! I see you are taking out the yellow scarf with blue stripes on it.

character_2_text.eng: Thank you, I love this scarf!

rows.character_2_text: Thank you, I love this scarf!

character_1_text.eng: Well done for getting that hat on by yourself, @data.characters.f1_son_5.name. You’re learning to do so many new things for yourself!”

rows.character_1_text: Well done for getting that hat on by yourself, @data.characters.f1_son_5.name. You’re learning to do so many new things for yourself!”

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s reflect on how @data.characters.f1_mother.name and @data.characters.f1_son_5.name spent one-on-one time together.

quiz_1_question.eng: How does @data.characters.f1_mother.name show her son, @data.characters.f1_son_5.name, that she is focusing on him?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:
Yes, she does all these things! 

By inviting child-led play, using his name, and getting on his level, @data.characters.f1_mother.name is building her son's confidence and making sure @data.characters.f1_son_5.name feels valued.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: She goes down to the same level as @data.characters.f1_son_5.name

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Yes, she does all these things! This way, @data.characters.f1_son_5.name knows that @data.characters.f1_mother.name really cares about him.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are some easy tips on how to connect with your child when you spend time together.

section_1_text.eng:
Spend at least 5 minutes a day with your child.
More time is even better!

section_2_text.eng:
Turn off the TV, put down your phone, and remove distractions.
Show your child you’re really listening and paying attention!

section_2_extra_text.eng:
- Look at your child. Get down to their level. Use their name.
- Describe what they are doing and feeling. Praise them.
- Your child will learn a lot from what you say and do.

section_3_text.eng: Let your child choose what to do or talk about. It helps them feel important. Ask to spend time together and try fun (even silly!) activities.

- Describe what they are doing and feeling. Praise them.
- Your child will learn a lot from what you say and do.
rows.section_3_text: Let your child choose what to do or talk about. It helps them feel important. Ask to spend time together and try fun (even silly!) activities.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Now that you have learned a few tips to connect with your child when you spend time together, let's put them into practise.

Let's think of ideas for how you can spend time with your child!

quiz_1_question.eng: How can you spend one-on-one time with your child?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:
Great idea!

Do you ever feel like you have NO TIME and are exhausted? Try to think of ways to make daily activities fun together.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Ready to try out your new skills? 

Your home activity is to spend 5 minutes (or more) of one-on-one time with your child, every day this week.

media_title.eng: Hear how one-on-one time helped @data.characters.media_female_1.name and her child connect

media_transcript.eng:
When I first heard I have to spend one-on-one time with my daughter, it was hard for me. I did not know when to do it or what to say. I did not want to spoil my daughter so that she thinks we have to do everything together. 

But I really wanted to build my relationship with her and I wanted her to open up about what was troubling her. 

So we tried the One-on-One Time. 

First, it felt weird, but it turned out to be fun! Now we play her favourite game together and talk about things happening at school and with her friends.

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you spend one-on-one time with your child every day this week?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That's great! Spending one-on-one time helps build trust and love between you and your child.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng:
You can do it! Try to spend a few minutes each day with your child.
It can be something simple, like eating together or doing a chore side by side.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng:
That’s okay. It gets easier as you build a routine.
At first, try finding moments that don’t take extra time—like doing a chore together.

quiz_2_question.eng: When will you spend one-on-one time with your child?

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: In the morning before starting the day

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Great start! Spending time with your child in the morning can set a positive tone for the rest of the day.

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Perfect! After school or daycare is a great time to reconnect with your child

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Wonderful! Sharing a meal together is a special way to bond and enjoy each other's company

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: Lovely choice! Bedtime is a calming time to connect, share stories, and end the day on a warm note.

quiz_2_option_5_text.eng: During a commute (e.g., driving to school or an activity)

quiz_2_feedback_5.eng: Great idea! Commutes are a great time to talk and spend time together.

quiz_2_feedback_6.eng: Great job! Making this a regular part of your routine helps create special one-on-one time with your child.
